page.title: 04THE RIBBLE WAY.
page.content: All over Britain,through the most beautiful scenery,wind small public footpaths.One recent addition to this nationwide network is the{"Ribble Way" It's course stays around the rivers {Ribble,Calder}and{Hodder}and passes through the countryside quite near to our School.When completed the total trail will cover about 65 miles.The trail begins at the estuary of the Ribble and continues to the river's source at{Ribblehead}in Yorkshire. In June 1985 15 children and 3 teachers from Salesbury School went for a walk on part of the Ribble Way. We covered 10 miles,a small proportion of the whole walk,beginning at{Dinckly and finishing at{Clitheroe.}This area is densely wooded with deciduous trees and is particularly popular with trout fishermen.During our walk the Ribble changed levels three times.{
